title: Understanding Evidence-Based Practice
text: Evidence-based practice (EBP) is a critical component in nursing that combines various elements to ensure effective patient care. It involves integrating research findings, clinical expertise, and patient preferences.

title: Components of EBP
text: Consider the three main components of evidence-based practice: formal research findings, nursing competency, and the preferences of the client and family. These elements work together to guide decision-making in patient care.

hintAnswer: the intersection of formal research findings, nursing competency, and the preferences of the client and family to plan client care
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes evidence-based practice in nursing?
choices: the collection of available data to inform care planning, to identify problems and develop a plan of care
critically examining the meaning of identified cues that inform the nurse on necessary levels of support for the client.
the intersection of formal research findings, nursing competency, and the preferences of the client and family to plan client care
